Vector: class to handle Vector operation.¶

Vector: class to handle Vector operation. For example, if you want to get length of a vector

from pymt import *
v = Vector(1, 5)

# get length
print Vector.length(v)
class pymt.vector.Vector(*largs)¶

Bases: list

Represents a 2D vector.

angle(a)¶
Computes the angle between a and b
distance(to)¶
Returns the distance between two points.
distance2(to)¶
Returns the distance between two points squared.
dot(a)¶
Computes the dot product of a and b
in_bbox¶
Return a true if point is in bbox defined by a and b
length()¶
Returns the length of a vector
line_intersection¶

Finds the intersection point between the lines (1)v1->v2 and (2)v3->v4 and returns it as a vector object

For math see: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Line-line_intersection

normalize()¶
Returns a new vector that has the same direction as vec, but has a length of one.
rotate(angle)¶
Rotate the vector
pymt.vector.matrix_inv_mult(m, v)¶
Takes an openGL matrix and a 2 Vector and returns the inverse of teh matrix applied to the vector
pymt.vector.matrix_trans_mult(m, v)¶
Takes an openGL matrix and a 2 Vector and return the transpose of teh matrix applied to the vector
pymt.vector.matrix_mult(m, v)¶
Takes an openGL matrix and a 2 Vector and returns the matrix applied to the vector
